Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2014 10:22PM inga6060 wrote: That is so common.  Take courage.  There is Mets all over in me. I do t worry about it.  I am treating my whole body.  I have actually noticed a reduction in the swelling with my liver.  Nurse did as well.  Yes, that's how bad mine is.You can visually see it swelled.  Couldn't even touch a few months ago.  No I can.  headed in right direction.  I am all natural.  So I really can't help you with the route you have chosen to take.  We all have our path.  I can tell you there are a lot of complimentary things you do with traditional. For instance, something real simple, that I thing has helped me a lot, is putting a drop or 2 of essential oil on liver every day.  Just food for thought.  Stay strong.  Attitude is everything!!
Posts.Title: Need hope and inspiration from others with liver mets Linnette1217 Cafelovr

Posts.Content: inga6060 wrote: Hi, I have been in stage 4 for a couple of years now.  Trying to heal all naturally.  Been a rough road.  I dropped the ball this year and ended up in the hospital with a gallon and a half of fluid in my chest cavity.  Got a tube put In.  Within 3 Weeks the. Tube came out, and so far haven't had that problem again.  So, I am on a protocol.  And there has been many  positives since then.  However, my cbc panel came back with even lower numbers than I had when I was in the hospital.  And I was not doing well in hospital.  Any ideas?  Can the numbers drop when u r healing?  I was told it was due to trauma happening.  Healing can b traumatizing as well.  Wondering if anyone has experienced this.  Also heard that platinum,.which is in chemo, can cause anemia.  I am not on chemo, but my natural product does contain something similar??? Posts.Title: anemia due to bone mets.trying to heal naturally inga6060 inga6060

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2014 11:26AM inga6060 wrote: Hey, thanks for all the info.  I am not seeing any doctors, because they have nothing to offer me.  I am seeing an integrative Dr.  It seems I know more about a lot of things than him.  Found out one of the supplements I'm on, poly mva, is a mild chemo.  It has an ingredient in it similar to chemo.  But it has none of the harmful effects.  I read that chemo can cause anemia.  I was taking iron.  I am gonna up my dose,  and start on blackstrap molasses.  Just don't want too much iron.  Cancer loves iron.  Gonna get my levels checked.

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2014 11:32AM inga6060 wrote: I did see an oncologist briefly, he had heard of the product I started taking.  He was the one that told me it had an ingredient in it similar to chemo.  That's all he said to me.  I am the one that did the research on it.  I am only on 2 different meds for pain.  Gabapentin and very low dose of long acting morphine.  I am doing really good considering.
